title: New research reveals how everyday cues secretly shape your habits
summary: Researchers uncovered how shifting levels of a brain protein called KCC2 can reshape the way cues become linked with rewards, sometimes making habits form more quickly or more powerfully than expected.

title: Scientists uncover the hidden survival trick that lets cancer bounce back
summary: Scientists discovered that certain cancer cells use a low-level activation of a DNA-dismantling enzyme—normally seen in cell death—to survive treatment.

title: Simple supplement mix shows remarkable results in brain cancer
summary: New research is challenging one of medicine’s oldest assumptions: that cancer must be attacked to be cured. By treating glioblastoma patients with a simple combination of resveratrol and copper, the researchers found dramatic reductions in tumor aggressiveness, cancer biomarkers, immune checkpoints, and stem-cell–related markers—all without side effects.

title: Blood tests reveal obesity rapidly accelerates Alzheimer’s progression
summary: Obesity accelerates the rise of Alzheimer’s-related blood biomarkers far more rapidly than previously recognized.

title: Scientists reveal a tiny brain chip that streams thoughts in real time
summary: BISC is an ultra-thin neural implant that creates a high-bandwidth wireless link between the brain and computers.

title: Human brains light up for chimp voices in a way no one expected
summary: Humans don’t just recognize each other’s voices—our brains also light up for the calls of chimpanzees, hinting at ancient communication roots shared with our closest primate relatives.

title: Rising temperatures are slowing early childhood development
summary: Researchers discovered that unusually high temperatures can hinder early childhood development.

title: A hidden mechanism changes what we know about cell division
summary: Researchers discovered that a long-misunderstood protein plays a key role in helping chromosomes latch onto the right “tracks” during cell division.

title: Why ultra-processed foods make teens eat more when they aren’t hungry
summary: A Virginia Tech study shows that ultra-processed foods may influence adolescents differently from slightly older young adults.

title: Some irritability is normal. Here’s when it’s not
Single enzyme mutation reveals a hidden trigger in dementia
summary: Researchers discovered that a tiny structural feature of the enzyme GPX4 helps keep neurons safe.

title: Simple light trick reveals hidden brain pathways in microscopic detail
summary: Microscopic fibers secretly shape how every organ in the body works, yet they’ve been notoriously hard to study—until now.

title: Most of the world isn’t getting enough omega-3
summary: Most people worldwide aren’t getting enough omega-3, leaving a major gap between scientific recommendations and daily diets.

title: Drought may have doomed the ‘hobbits’ of Flores
GLP-1 drugs failed to slow Alzheimer’s in two big clinical trials
Her food cravings vanished on Mounjaro then roared back
summary: Deep-brain recordings showed that Mounjaro and Zepbound briefly shut down the craving circuits linked to food noise in a patient with severe obesity. Her obsessive thoughts about food disappeared as the medication quieted the nucleus accumbens, the brain’s reward hub.

title: Low dose melanoma treatment delivers dramatically better results
summary: Using less ipilimumab appears to make melanoma immunotherapy both safer and more effective, with dramatically better response and survival outcomes. The findings suggest that reducing side effects may be the key to maximizing the benefits of these powerful treatments.

title: Garlic mouthwash shows shockingly strong germ-fighting power
summary: Garlic extract is emerging as a surprisingly powerful contender to chlorhexidine, the long-standing “gold standard” in antimicrobial mouthwashes. A systematic review of clinical studies shows that higher-concentration garlic mouthwash can rival chlorhexidine in killing bacteria—sometimes outperforming it—while offering a more natural alternative.

title: This tiny implant sends secret messages to the brain
summary: Researchers have built a fully implantable device that sends light-based messages directly to the brain.

title: Gut molecule shows remarkable anti-diabetes power
summary: Researchers revealed that the microbial metabolite TMA can directly block the immune protein IRAK4, reducing inflammation and improving insulin sensitivity.

title: Scientists uncover a volcanic trigger behind the Black Death
summary: A newly analyzed set of climate data points to a major volcanic eruption that may have played a key role in the Black Death’s arrival.

title: New study finds a silent genetic heart risk hidden in millions
summary: A large Mayo Clinic study shows that current guidelines fail to detect nearly 90% of people with familial hypercholesterolemia, a common inherited cause of dangerously high cholesterol.

title: This simple ingredient makes kale way healthier
summary: Scientists found that kale’s prized nutrients are hard for the body to absorb unless they’re eaten with oil.

title: Humans are built for nature not modern life
summary: Human biology evolved for a world of movement, nature, and short bursts of stress—not the constant pressure of modern life.

title: The rotten egg smell that could finally beat nail fungus
summary: Researchers have identified hydrogen sulfide as a surprisingly effective tool for treating difficult nail infections. It penetrates nails more efficiently than current drugs and kills pathogens by disrupting their energy systems. The compound also works against fungi that resist standard antifungal treatments.

title: New fat-burning diabetes pill protects muscle and appetite
summary: Researchers have developed a new oral drug that boosts metabolic activity in muscle rather than altering appetite like GLP-1 drugs.

title: Scientists say this viral rosemary skincare trend actually works
summary: Researchers have found scientific support for the viral claim that rosemary can improve wound healing.

title: Scientists keep a human alive with a genetically engineered pig liver
summary: Researchers successfully implanted a genetically modified pig liver into a human, proving that such an organ can function for an extended period.

title: Scientists find hidden layers in brain’s memory center
summary: Scientists uncovered a surprising four-layer structure hidden inside the hippocampal CA1 region, one of the brain’s major centers for memory, navigation, and emotion.

title: Natural hormone unlocks a hidden fat burning switch
summary: FGF19 triggers the brain to burn more energy and activate fat-burning cells, offering a potential new path for obesity treatments.

title: A CDC panel has struck down universal newborn hepatitis B vaccination
summary: A reshaped vaccine committee voted to scale back newborn hepatitis B shots despite decades of data showing the birth dose is safe, effective and vital.

title: Scientists find hidden brain nutrient drop that may fuel anxiety
summary: Researchers found that people with anxiety disorders consistently show lower choline levels in key brain regions that regulate thinking and emotions.

title: Next gen cancer drug shows surprising anti aging power
summary: A next-generation drug tested in yeast was found to extend lifespan and slow aging by influencing a major growth-control pathway.

title: Scientists reveal a powerful heart boost hidden in everyday foods
summary: Regular consumption of polyphenol-rich foods like tea, coffee, berries, nuts, and whole grains may significantly support long-term heart health.

title: Experimental RNA treatment shows surprising DNA repair power
summary: Cedars-Sinai scientists have created a new experimental drug called TY1 that helps the body repair damaged DNA and restore injured tissue.

title: Alzheimer’s blood tests may be misleading for people with kidney problems
summary: A large study found that people with impaired kidneys tend to have higher Alzheimer’s biomarkers, yet they don’t face a higher overall risk of dementia.

title: How a bacterial toxin linked to colon cancer messes with DNA
summary: A closeup look at colibactin’s structure reveals chemical motifs that guide its mutation-wreaking “warheads” to specific stretches of DNA.

title: A volcanic eruption might have helped bring the Black Plague to Europe
Simple nutrient mix delivers surprising autism breakthrough in mice
summary: A low-dose mix of zinc, serine, and branched-chain amino acids boosted neural function and social behavior in autism mouse models.

title: Daily coffee may slow biological aging in mental illness
summary: Researchers studying people with major psychiatric disorders found that drinking up to four cups of coffee a day is associated with longer telomeres.

title: Scientists capture flu viruses surfing into human cells in real time
summary: Scientists have captured a never-before-seen, high-resolution look at influenza’s stealthy invasion of human cells, revealing that the cells aren’t just helpless victims.

title: Gas stoves are filling millions of homes with hidden toxic air
summary: Stanford researchers found that gas stoves expose Americans to surprisingly high levels of nitrogen dioxide—often matching or exceeding outdoor pollution.

title: A 70-year-old pregnancy drug just revealed a hidden weakness in brain cancer
summary: Researchers have solved the decades-old mystery behind how a common pregnancy drug lowers blood pressure. It turns out the medication blocks a fast-acting “oxygen alarm” inside cells. That same alarm helps brain tumors survive, meaning the drug unexpectedly weakens them, too.

title: Is your gut being poisoned? Scientists reveal the hidden impact of everyday chemicals
summary: Researchers discovered that 168 common chemicals can disrupt the growth of beneficial gut bacteria, with some also promoting antibiotic resistance. Many of these substances—found in food, water, and household items—weren’t previously suspected of affecting living organisms.

title: A routine shingles shot may offer powerful defense against dementia
summary: A unique vaccine rollout in Wales gave researchers an accidental natural experiment that revealed a striking reduction in dementia among seniors who received the shingles vaccine.

title: Scientists reveal what really drives the “freshman 15”
summary: College life creates a perfect storm for overeating, as students consume more calories when surrounded by friends, eating in dining halls, or following unstructured schedules.

title: A common constipation drug shows a surprising ability to protect kidneys
summary: A surprising link between constipation and kidney decline led researchers to test lubiprostone, revealing that it can protect kidney function.

title: Your sweat reveals health problems long before symptoms appear

title: Scientists boost lifespan by 70% in elderly male mice using simple drug combo
summary: Scientists found that combining oxytocin with an Alk5 inhibitor revitalized extremely old male mice, boosting their lifespan and strength.

title: Scientists discover first gene proven to directly cause mental illness
summary: Scientists have discovered that a single gene, GRIN2A, can directly cause mental illness—something previously thought to stem only from many genes acting together.

summary: Younger women are being diagnosed with breast cancer more often than screening guidelines anticipate.

title: Personalized ‘prehabilitation’ helps the body brace for major surgery
summary: A small study finds that individualized prehab can dampen harmful immune responses and may reduce complications after an operation.

title: A therapeutic HPV vaccine shrank cervical tumors in mice
summary: An HPV vaccine delivered into the nose can treat cervical tumors in mice. The vaccine targets a cancer protein produced by the virus.
